channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Schneider Electric CEO Olivier Blum credits his time as CHRO for shaping his leadership style: Success is ‘90% about the people you put in the job’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Workers and Employers Face Higher Health Insurance Costs
item.description: A new employer survey shows premiums for a family climbed in 2025 as companies and their workers pay more for coverage.

item.title: Trump’s $230 Million Demand, and the Chaos Created by U.S.A.I.D. Cuts in Somalia
Sam Altman’s OpenAI is coming for Wall Street’s grunt workers as AI continues to transform the entry level
item.description: Experts say automation of low-level tasks in finance will “transform” rather than “eliminate” roles on Wall Street.

item.title: Le Heist
item.description: How thieves were able to pull off an audacious robbery of priceless jewels from the Louvre in broad daylight.

item.title: Ray Dalio says his AI clone will be able to give you investment and career insights whenever you want
item.description: Ray Dalio has a waitlist for “Digital Ray,” an AI clone designed to talk to the public.

item.title: Can Europe find the political energy to become competitive again?
item.description: “Europe is not just a beautiful idea; it’s a powerful and stable economic space. And that’s what we want to preserve," says Stéphane Séjourné.

item.title: This Global 500 energy CEO says the model for the global corporation that worked for 20 years is obsolete—here’s what he’s building instead
item.description: In a wide-ranging interview with Fortune, Schneider Electric CEO Olivier Blum, lays out his vision for his vast enterprise.

item.title: Civilian Massacres Follow Syrian Leaders’ Promises of Peace
item.description: Ten months after rebels toppled the long-entrenched Assad regime, little-checked bloodshed has led many Syrians to abandon hope that the years of brut...

item.title: Vance Says He’s Not in Israel to Babysit Gaza Cease-Fire
item.description: Vice President JD Vance, on the second day of a trip to the country, said recent visits by top American officials were to monitor the cease-fire, but ...

item.title: Louvre Reopens for First Time Since Brazen Jewelry Robbery
item.description: French authorities are under growing scrutiny about whether security failings allowed four thieves to steal royal jewelry worth over $100 million.

item.title: World Falling Short on Methane Pledge, U.N. Report Finds
item.description: Several agency programs are trying to track and reduce methane emissions around the world. They aren’t meeting the targets fast enough.

item.title: Civilian Massacres Follow Syrian Leaders’ Promises of Peace
item.description: Ten months after rebels toppled the long-entrenched Assad regime, little-checked bloodshed has led many Syrians to abandon hope that the years of brut...

item.title: Drone Sightings in Europe: What We Know
item.description: Airports in several countries have temporarily closed in recent weeks after reports of drones in the skies. Experts say the response has exposed a lac...

item.title: How President Trump Uses A.I.
item.description: The era of A.I. propaganda is here — and Trump is an enthusiastic participant.
